intro: Thesium amblystachyum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Thesium amblystachyum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
